Class Caesar

java.lang.Object
Caesar
public class Caesar
extends java.lang.Object
A command line tool to apply a shift cipher to an input string, given any shift integer.

Usage: Caesar n "cipher text"

  • Constructor Details

    • Caesar

      public Caesar()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Applies a shift cipher to the cipher text given a shift integer n.

      This code will validate the number of arguments and provide the user with feedback if their input in incorrect.

      If the input is correct then this function will convert the inputs to appropriate data types and then pass them on to the function rotate().

      Parameters:
      args - args[0] is the rotation as a String and args[1] is the text to be rotated.

    • rotate

      public static java.lang.String rotate​(int shift, java.lang.String text)
      Rotates a string into cipher text by the given shift value.

      Rotation is achieved by starting with an empty string and iterating through each letter of the input string. This letter is passed to rotate(int, char) and appended onto the resultant string.

      Parameters:
      shift - An integer value to shift the text by. Can be positive or negative and will wrap around if it exceeds the alphabet.
      text - The string to be converted to cipher text.
      Returns:
      The shifted cipher text.

    • rotate

      public static char rotate​(int shift, char letter)
      Rotates a single char by the given shift value.

      Rotation is achieved by first converting the shift value to a positive offset. It is then checked whether the character is upper-case or lower; if it is neither then the original character is returned.

      For upper-case the new character is calculated as a positive offset from A mod 26. This offset is then added to A and the character is returned.

      For lower-case the new character is calculates as a positive offset from a mod 26. This offset is then added to a and the character is returned.

      Parameters:
      shift - An integer value to shift the text by. Can be positive or negative and will wrap around if it exceeds the alphabet.
      letter - A char to be shifted.
      Returns:
      In the case of a letter - the shifted letter will be returned. For all other characters, the original character is returned.
